meanings.sent1: The overbrief explanation left me confused.
meanings.sent2: Her overbrief response didn't provide enough details.
meanings.sent3: The overbrief summary of the movie missed all the important parts.
meanings.sent4: His overbrief speech was like a blink-and-you-miss-it moment.
meanings.sent5: The overbrief instructions were easy to forget.

meanings.definition: To make excessively brief or concise
meanings.sent1: She tends to overbrief her presentations, leaving out crucial information.
meanings.sent2: I will overbrief the report to save time during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally overbriefed the recipe, resulting in a disastrous dish.
meanings.sent4: The editor had to overbrief the article to fit it on one page.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to overbrief the lesson due to time constraints.
